On Sept. 21st, we held the Orientation Day for our freshmen K14. The main event consisted of short conversations about the faculty's specs as well as the problem of adaptation raised among the newcomers; a tour to the electrical and electronics engineering labs with demonstrations given by the professors and lecturers currently working at the University; a fun and easy tutorial made by Pay It Forward Club to help the freshmen get familiar with the real basic components of a circuit; and finally, group games operated by the newly founded Skills Club. Besides, we had a very good time with great singers who volunteered to give their voices to others, one of them actually came from the Civil Engineering!
Afterwards, everybody got exhausted, but that did not stop us from being together, all become one on stage. 
From the beginning, some of us may not even know the others' names, nevertheless, we feel like it was a family we were in afterall. It was a wonderful day, thanks to you all!
We would like to give our sincerely thanks to the ones who helped us organize this event. If there's a piece of advice for you K14, it's that you keep doin' what you're doin' 'cause you're doin' it right!
- Our team of DEE Media Division -
